data.text: @Unusual_Times I’ve been out of the loop recently (hence copied graphs, can’t even be bothered to export data) but, just in case no-one’s looked, the rise in admissions in South West is particularly in Devon, Somerset, Wiltshire, Gloucester. Nothing noticeable in my neck of the woods Dorset… https://t.co/Fi5FtVvkzS

@Unusual_Times @londoner_007 The PHO in BC did that when P1 arrived.

They don't want us to know it's getting worse because that's bad for the economy.
@Unusual_Times I've just seen this, it may explain the lack data for a while https://t.co/961Fmi50iu

@Unusual_Times The Gov figures for infection in my area of Cornwall are in single figures yet I personally know of over 15 families that are infected in the village so it seems the official figures mean fuck all.
@Em_Lickspittle @AdsMac @karamballes @Unusual_Times This virus was brought to you by the Pension Funds.

@AdsMac @karamballes @Unusual_Times That this virus not only reduces life expectancy but affects men's fertility so much, is pretty much a massive red flag to me. Population rends are being pinched at both ends and we'll see that play through and be clea rin the stats over the coming 5 years.

@AdsMac @karamballes @Unusual_Times Adam, I hold the controversial view, and which I hold regardless of the origins debate, that this pandemic is being used to put populations trends into decline given the climate change crisis and that you can't have consumer based capitalism with so many people. 1/2

@Em_Lickspittle @karamballes @Unusual_Times I think you’re right from the little I know. Seems to me we need the medical breakthroughs soon, before the huge investment, resource and global focus moves like it has in the West (I.e. forget about it and move on).

@AdsMac @karamballes @Unusual_Times I don't think saving lives and safeguarding health is an aim anymore given wider contexts. You do know fertility is being affected in men right? And that having this virus circulating constantly means we will see birth rates drop of a cliff too?

@AdsMac @karamballes @Unusual_Times Looking at the disease profile and the decades of research on sars 1, ace2 etc, and which was conveniently 'forgotten' when the pandemic begun, I would say avg life expectancy is going to tank, 50-60 tops unless vaccine breakthroughs and general anti viral meds for all.
